data.name: Side-Sorting Robot
data.description:
Side-Sorting Robot You've built a robot, with this special ability:
It can handle balls with numbers written on them standing on a track in front of it.
Image recognition is quite good, and the robot can see all the balls and the numbers on them.
The robot has one arm, but the actions it can make with the balls are limited to 2:
- Choose a specific ball, take it and drop it at the leftmost end of the balls line. - Choose a specific ball, take it and drop it at the rightmost end of the balls line. You need to implement an AI to enable the robot to sort the balls:
No matter what numbers are on the balls, you want the robot to sort the balls, according to these numbers, into a non-increasing order, with the minimal number of moves.
The word "minimal" is important here.
There can be duplicates in the numbers.
examples:
2 3 1
-> 3 goes left
3 2 1
(1 move needed)
=> 1
1 5 9 5 1:
-> 9 goes left
9 1 5 5 1
-> 1 goes right
9 5 5 1 1
(2 moves needed)
=> 2
2 1 2 5 0 0 1 1:
-> 5 goes left
5 2 1 2 0 0 1 1
-> 1 goes right
5 2 2 0 0 1 1 1
-> 0 goes right
5 2 2 0 1 1 1 0
-> 0 goes right
5 2 2 1 1 1 0 0
(4 moves needed)
=> 4
There can be up to 100.000 balls,
integers i on them can be negative,
1.000.000 < i < 1.000.000
INPUT:
an array of integers OUTPUT:
The minimal number of moves needed to sort the balls.
